activityCategory: WASH-1. Water Access
Indicator: Syrian Boys in Urban - # benefiting from improved access to safe water in schools and in the host communities.
comments:
Improvement of access to safe water and sanitation for  Syrian refugees and Jordanians in most-affected communities through rehabilitation of water supply infrastructure and sanitation services in public buildings.  

Water supply intervention to be conducted simultaneously with sanitation infrastructure rehabilitation. As such results for activities for WASH rehabilitation will be reported under WASH1.3 to avoid duplication.

activity: 3. Access to safe water in host communities
activityCategory: WASH-1. Water Access
Indicator: Women - Other affected Population - # having improved access to safe water
comments: Improvement of access to safe water supply and sanitation through rehabilitation of WASH infrastructure at a household level. Activity was submitted under WASH1.3 and WASH and 2.4 to RRP6,  as WASH rehabilitation's address both water supply and sanitation needs of beneficiary households the data for the activity has been recorded under one activity and will be reported accordingly to avoid duplication.

activityCategory: WASH-1. Water Access
Indicator: Syrian Men in Urban - # having improved access to safe water
comments: Improvement of access to safe water supply and sanitation through rehabilitation of WASH infrastructure at a household level. Activity was submitted under WASH1.3 and WASH and 2.4 to RRP6,  as WASH rehabilitation's address both water supply and sanitation needs of beneficiary households the data for the activity has been recorded under one activity and will be reported accordingly to avoid duplication.

activityCategory: WASH-3. Hygiene Promotion & Hygiene Products Delivery
Indicator: Syrian Boys in Camp
comments:
ACTED is the largest hygiene promotion actor operating in Za’atari Camp and is the only hygiene promotion actor operating in Cyber City and King Abdullah Park. As of 31 January 2014, ACTED’s Hygiene Promotion Team in Za’atari Camp consisted of 75 Syrian Hygiene Promoters, 10 Hygiene Promotion Distributors, and 16 Hygiene Promotion Supervisors. Both King Abdullah Park and Cyber City each had one hygiene promoter.

Beneficiaries in King Abdullah Park:
264 men
286 women
216 boys
234 girls

activityCategory: WASH-3. Hygiene Promotion & Hygiene Products Delivery
Indicator: Syrian Girls in Camp
comments:
ACTED is the largest hygiene promotion actor operating in Za’atari Camp and is the only hygiene promotion actor operating in Cyber City and King Abdullah Park. As of 31 January 2014, ACTED’s Hygiene Promotion Team in Za’atari Camp consisted of 75 Syrian Hygiene Promoters, 10 Hygiene Promotion Distributors, and 16 Hygiene Promotion Supervisors. Both King Abdullah Park and Cyber City each had one hygiene promoter.

Beneficiaries in Cyber City:
132 men
143 women
108 boys
117 girls

activity: 3. Access to safe water in host communities
activityCategory: WASH-1. Water Access
Indicator: Women - Other affected Population - # having improved access to safe water
comments: IRD's OSIR (Outreach for Services for Syrian and Iraqi Refguees) project rehabilitated the Hakama well #10 in the Irbid Governorate. The total estimated number of beneficiaries is 35,000. IRD does not have a breakdown of beneficiaries by age, gender, and nationality; thus, the total figure was divided evenly among all beneficiary groups so that the total number would be represented in the data.

As of 31 January 2014, ACTED’s Hygiene Promotion Team in Za’atari Camp consisted of 75 Syrian Hygiene Promoters, 10 Hygiene Promotion Distributors, and 16 Hygiene Promotion Supervisors. Both King Abdullah Park and Cyber City each had one hygiene promoter.

Beneficiaries in King Abdullah Park:
264 men
286 women
216 boys
234 girls

Both King Abdullah Park and Cyber City each had one hygiene promoter.

Beneficiaries in Cyber City:
132 men
143 women
108 boys
117 girls

Indicator: Syrian Men in Camp - # with access to potable water in camps as per the agreed minimum standards.
comments: ACTED is responsible for supplying water (at least 35 liters per person per day) via water trucking in Za’atari refugee camp. Water supply via water trucking will gradually be phased out after the new water supply network is constructed .

activityCategory: WASH-3. Hygiene Promotion & Hygiene Products Delivery
Indicator: Syrian Women in Camp
comments:
ACTED is the largest hygiene promotion actor operating in Za’atari Camp and is the only hygiene promotion actor operating in Cyber City and King Abdullah Park. As of 31 January 2014, ACTED’s Hygiene Promotion Team in Za’atari Camp consisted of 75 Syrian Hygiene Promoters, 10 Hygiene Promotion Distributors, and 16 Hygiene Promotion Supervisors. Both King Abdullah Park and Cyber City each had one hygiene promoter.

Only in ACTED Districts 1/2/9/10/11/12.

Beneficiaries in Za'atari Camp:
10,400 men
12,850 women
13,600 boys
13,150 girls

activityCategory: WASH-1. Water Access
Indicator: Girls - Other affected Population- # benefiting from improved access to safe water in schools and in the host communities.
comments:
Improvement of access to safe water and sanitation for  Syrian refugees and Jordanians in most-affected communities through rehabilitation of water supply infrastructure and sanitation services in public buildings.  

Water supply intervention to be conducted simultaneously with sanitation infrastructure rehabilitation. As such results for activities for WASH rehabilitation will be reported under WASH1.3 to avoid duplication. 

Syrian children in Urban benefiting from improved access to WASH facilities in schools:50
Other affected Population in Urban  benefiting from improved WASH facilities in schools:795

ACTED is the largest hygiene promotion actor operating in Za’atari Camp and is the only hygiene promotion actor operating in Cyber City and King Abdullah Park. Both King Abdullah Park and Cyber City each had one hygiene promoter.

activityCategory: WASH-2. Sanitation / Protection from the spread of disease
Indicator: Syrian Boys in Camp
comments:
Mobilization and revitalization of WASH Committees, describing  responsibilities to members and community. Ultimate goal: WASH facility handover to community.

WASH facility handover is in all districts.

As of 30 April 2014, 87% of WASH facilities across all districts had been handed to WASH committees.
There are 14 Cash for Work WASH Community Mobilizers (6 female and 8 male), one Senior Community Mobilizer (one male) and one Community Mobilization Deputy Manager (female). 

Throughout the reporting period, ACTED’s Community Mobilization Team handed over no WASH facilities, as the contractor did not complete the maintenance of any WASH facilities in District 11 under UNICEF’s instructions. As of 31 January, in ACTED districts there are currently 22 functioning WASH committees: 10 in District 9, and 12 in District 10.

comments:
ACTED is the largest hygiene promotion actor operating in Za’atari Camp and is the only hygiene promotion actor operating in Cyber City and King Abdullah Park. As of 31 January 2014, ACTED’s Hygiene Promotion Team in Za’atari Camp consisted of 75 Syrian Hygiene Promoters, 10 Hygiene Promotion Distributors, and 16 Hygiene Promotion Supervisors. Both King Abdullah Park and Cyber City each had one hygiene promoter.

Only in ACTED Districts 1/2/9/10/11/12.

activityCategory: WASH-2. Sanitation / Protection from the spread of disease
Indicator: Syrian Boys in Camp
comments:
Mobilization and revitalization of WASH Committees, describing  responsibilities to members and community. Ultimate goal: WASH facility handover to community.

WASH facility handover is in all districts.

As of 30 April 2014, 87% of WASH facilities across all districts had been handed to WASH committees.
There are 14 Cash for Work WASH Community Mobilizers (6 female and 8 male), one Senior Community Mobilizer (one male) and one Community Mobilization Deputy Manager (female). 

Throughout the reporting period, ACTED’s Community Mobilization Team handed over no WASH facilities, as the contractor did not complete the maintenance of any WASH facilities in District 11 under UNICEF’s instructions. As of 31 January, in ACTED districts there are currently 22 functioning WASH committees: 10 in District 9, and 12 in District 10.

comments:
Mobilization and revitalization of WASH Committees, describing  responsibilities to members and community. Ultimate goal: WASH facility handover to community.

WASH facility handover is in all districts.

As of 30 April 2014, 87% of WASH facilities across all districts had been handed to WASH committees.
There are 14 Cash for Work WASH Community Mobilizers (6 female and 8 male), one Senior Community Mobilizer (one male) and one Community Mobilization Deputy Manager (female). 

Throughout the reporting period, ACTED’s Community Mobilization Team handed over no WASH facilities, as the contractor did not complete the maintenance of any WASH facilities in District 11 under UNICEF’s instructions. As of 31 January, in ACTED districts there are currently 22 functioning WASH committees: 10 in District 9, and 12 in District 10.

comments:
Mobilization and revitalization of WASH Committees, describing  responsibilities to members and community. Ultimate goal: WASH facility handover to community.

WASH facility handover is in all districts.

As of 30 April 2014, 87% of WASH facilities across all districts had been handed to WASH committees.
There are 14 Cash for Work WASH Community Mobilizers (6 female and 8 male), one Senior Community Mobilizer (one male) and one Community Mobilization Deputy Manager (female). 

Throughout the reporting period, ACTED’s Community Mobilization Team handed over no WASH facilities, as the contractor did not complete the maintenance of any WASH facilities in District 11 under UNICEF’s instructions. As of 31 January, in ACTED districts there are currently 22 functioning WASH committees: 10 in District 9, and 12 in District 10.
